Description: Shoulder sherd of North Ionian, possibly Clazomenian, pottery black-figured neck-amphora; exterior: painted decoration consisting of five rows of scale pattern, each scale with small white dot.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Cook notes that although the scales are typical of Clazomenian black figure pottery, they are not exclusive to Clazomenian pottery and therefore, the origin of this specific sherd cannot be confirmed although Clazomenian scales tend to be long (Cook 1952, 143, n. 102, no. 7). For parallels, see Heidelberg I28.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 53, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.125) (phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: IV.1 (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
